snippet: A government subsidy critical to the survival of hospitals treating large numbers of poor patients is being sharply reduced under the new health law.
abstract: Government subsidy critical to survival of hospitals treating large numbers of poor patients is being sharply reduced under Affordable Care Act; Supreme Court in 2012 gave states right to opt out of major expansion of Medicaid; half the states, almost all of them Republican-led, refused to broaden program, resulting in many poor people becoming even more vulnerable.
lead_paragraph: A government subsidy critical to the survival of hospitals treating large numbers of poor patients is being sharply reduced under the new health law.

headline.main: Cuts in Hospital Subsidies Threaten Safety-Net Care
headline.print_headline: Cuts in Hospital Subsidies Threaten Safety-Net Care

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
